title: Timothy Leary
summary: Timothy Francis Leary (October 22, 1920 â€“ May 31, 1996) was an American psychologist and writer known for his strong advocacy of psychedelic drugs.[2][3] Evaluations of Leary are polarized, ranging from bold oracle to publicity hound. He was "a hero of American consciousness", according to Allen Ginsberg, and Tom Robbins called him a "brave neuronaut".[4]
